intro: Ranunculus grenierianus, commonly known as the Grenier's buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically features delicate, palmate leaves and produces bright yellow or orange flowers with numerous stamens. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
